revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-31 17:08:35.000000000', 'files': ['meta/main.yml'], 'message': "Ensure that pip lock down happens before other dependencies

The pip_install role is depended on by a lot of other roles, and
therefore sometimes gets processed prior to the pip_lock_down
role resulting in the pip, setuptools and wheels packages being
installed from a source other than the repo server once the repo
server is available. This is not the intended behaviour - the

commit_message:
Ensure that pip lock down happens before other dependencies

The pip_install role is depended on by a lot of other roles, and
therefore sometimes gets processed prior to the pip_lock_down
role resulting in the pip, setuptools and wheels packages being
installed from a source other than the repo server once the repo
server is available. This is not the intended behaviour - the
repo server should always be a the primary source once it's
available.

This patch ensures that the pip_lock_down role is applied before
all the other dependent roles to ensure that the expected
behaviour is followed.

Change-Id: Ib899784e1f38914df37267418a5df77b7aa88737

commit_message:
Ensure that pip lock down happens before other dependencies

The pip_install role is depended on by a lot of other roles, and
therefore sometimes gets processed prior to the pip_lock_down
role resulting in the pip, setuptools and wheels packages being
installed from a source other than the repo server once the repo
server is available. This is not the intended behaviour - the
repo server should always be a the primary source once it's
available.

This patch ensures that the pip_lock_down role is applied before
all the other dependent roles to ensure that the expected
behaviour is followed.

Change-Id: Ic310ea918c3bfe8e63bd684eb3e8b26342299741

commit_message:
Increase heap for elasticsearch in func tests

We're seeing a number of outofmemory exceptions from elasticsearch.
Increasing the java heap space to 50m to see if that helps temporarily;
longer term we need to look at using fewer processes.

Change-Id: I32277b0613b1ee1a25005655b108fe2b6530679b

commit_message:
Warn instead of fail in case or wrong message format

If Astute for any reason generate wrong message, now it
will write warning in the log and send it to Nailgun without
any changes. All mesages which should send to Nailgun,
should be covered by unit tests.

Change-Id: I0955647600bc40677a916a99508cb4da9f9d387c
Related-Bug: #1561608

subject: Rolling upgrades of ceph osd cluster
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-31 18:37:50.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/ceph.py', 'hooks/ceph_hooks.py', 'unit_tests/test_upgrade_roll.py', 'hooks/charmhelpers/contrib/storage/linux/ceph.py', 'tests/basic_deployment.py', 'templates/ceph.conf', 'charm-helpers-hooks.yaml'], 'message': "Rolling upgrades of ceph osd cluster

This change adds functionality to allow the ceph osd cluster to
upgrade in a serial rolled fashion.  This will use the ceph monitor
cluster to lock and allows only 1 ceph osd server at a time to upgrade.
The upgrade is initiated setting a config value for source for the
service which will prompt the osd cluster to upgrade to that new
source and restart all osds processes server by server.  If an osd
server has been waiting on a previous server for more than 10 minutes
and hasn't seen it finish it will assume it died during the upgrade
and proceed with its own upgrade.

I had to modify the amulet test slightly to use the ceph-mon charm
instead of the default ceph charm.  I also changed the test so that
it uses 3 ceph-osd servers instead of 1.

Limtations of this patch: If the osd failure domain has been set to osd
than this patch will cause brief temporary outages while osd processes
are being restarted.  Future work will handle this case.

This reverts commit db09fdce938a7c2726beee643ddf0e9091966db3.

Change-Id: Ied010278085611b6d552e050a9d2bfdad7f3d35d
"}]
commit_message:
Rolling upgrades of ceph osd cluster

This change adds functionality to allow the ceph osd cluster to
upgrade in a serial rolled fashion.  This will use the ceph monitor
cluster to lock and allows only 1 ceph osd server at a time to upgrade.
The upgrade is initiated setting a config value for source for the
service which will prompt the osd cluster to upgrade to that new
source and restart all osds processes server by server.  If an osd
server has been waiting on a previous server for more than 10 minutes
and hasn't seen it finish it will assume it died during the upgrade
and proceed with its own upgrade.

I had to modify the amulet test slightly to use the ceph-mon charm
instead of the default ceph charm.  I also changed the test so that
it uses 3 ceph-osd servers instead of 1.

Limtations of this patch: If the osd failure domain has been set to osd
than this patch will cause brief temporary outages while osd processes
are being restarted.  Future work will handle this case.

This reverts commit db09fdce938a7c2726beee643ddf0e9091966db3.

Change-Id: Ied010278085611b6d552e050a9d2bfdad7f3d35d

This change enables a WADL2RST conversion, and resource_type is
not necessary in this case. So, to ease migration, make this change
to WADL source.

subject: Standardise nova functional tests and add actual tests
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-03-31 13:13:29.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test-prepare-host.yml', 'tests/inventory', 'tasks/nova_compute_kvm_install.yml', 'tasks/nova_console_novnc_install.yml', 'tests/test-install-neutron.yml', 'tests/test-prepare-keys.yml', 'tests/test.yml', 'tests/test-vars.yml', 'tests/test-install-infra.yml', 'tests/test-prepare-containers.yml', 'tests/test-install-nova.yml', 'tests/ansible-role-requirements.yml', 'tests/test-nova-functional.yml', 'tests/test-install-keystone.yml', 'tests/group_vars/all_containers.yml', 'tests/test-install-glance.yml'], 'message': 'Standardise nova functional tests and add actual tests

This commit breaks out the tests/test.yml file into sub task files and
deploys all the necessary components (keystone, glance, neutron) to
boot nova instances.  The functional test validates a few nova ports
and then proceeds to creating to a glance image and neutron network
bits before spinning up an instance.

Additionally, this change does the following:

- fully defines the inventory rather than having test-prepare-host.yml
  add containers to it
- removes installation of lxc_python2 library, since this is no longer
  necessary
- updates test-prepare-keys.yml to use localhost instead of 127.0.0.1,
  uses become_user=jenkins instead of become=false, and removes
  redundant connection
- updates test-prepare-host.yml by removing redundant become and
  connection options, changes 127.0.0.1 to localhost, and removes
  mocking ansible_env
- groups vars in defined in each individual file into a single
  test-vars.yml file

Change-Id: I80b1923cbf5c4375d2fb71bc71c326d43f1443b4
'}]
commit_message:
Standardise nova functional tests and add actual tests

This commit breaks out the tests/test.yml file into sub task files and
deploys all the necessary components (keystone, glance, neutron) to
boot nova instances.  The functional test validates a few nova ports
and then proceeds to creating to a glance image and neutron network
bits before spinning up an instance.

Additionally, this change does the following:

- fully defines the inventory rather than having test-prepare-host.yml
  add containers to it
- removes installation of lxc_python2 library, since this is no longer
  necessary
- updates test-prepare-keys.yml to use localhost instead of 127.0.0.1,
  uses become_user=jenkins instead of become=false, and removes
  redundant connection
- updates test-prepare-host.yml by removing redundant become and
  connection options, changes 127.0.0.1 to localhost, and removes
  mocking ansible_env
- groups vars in defined in each individual file into a single
  test-vars.yml file

Change-Id: I80b1923cbf5c4375d2fb71bc71c326d43f1443b4

project requires a baremetal host for CI. It will be

commit_message:
Add tripleo-quickstart project to tripleo team

The first step in replacing instack-virt-setup with
tripleo-quickstart[1], is to import the repo into the
openstack git.

Note, CI jobs are intentionally left out, because this
project requires a baremetal host for CI. It will be
covered by third-party CI.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-specs/tree/specs/mitaka/tripleo-quickstart.rst

Needed-By: Ic7f8639059c51044b261d387461f07f59e1aa69a
Change-Id: Ieaf0a4204a5137b3d8b5e1eda8bf872d5cc091f3

commit_message:
Keystone test cleanup

This commit does the following:

- splits out test.yml into multiple files
- fully defines the inventory rather than having test-prepare-host.yml
  add containers to it
- removes installation of lxc-python library, since this is no longer
  necessary
- removes stand-alone and stand-alone.yml as those are not being used
  anywhere
- updates test-prepare-keys.yml to use localhost instead of 127.0.0.1,
  uses become_user=jenkins instead of become=false, and removes
  redundant connection
- updates test-prepare-host.yml by removing redundant become and
  connection options, changes 127.0.0.1 to localhost, and removes
  mocking ansible_env
- groups vars in test-install-keystone.yml and
  test-keystone-functional.yml into test-vars.yml so they're only
  defined once

Change-Id: I914cc248c53a70e15c7caf0b84f7c94447077894

commit_message:
centos-cloud-rdo.repo is not available anymore

centos-cloud-rdo.repo is not available anymore on buildlogs.centos.org,
this breaks the CI. We use instead the last current-passed-ci snapshot
from delorean.

Closes-Bug: 1564558
Change-Id: If4da5d607e464d3561c641446f705ff53317f5a1

commit_message:
Add hardening support

Add charmhelpers.contrib.hardening and calls to install,
config-changed, upgrade-charm and update-status hooks.
Also add new config option to allow one or more hardening
modules to be applied at runtime.

Change-Id: I0f3035c8f8feae90ad3572297fab0ac28e7d97e2

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-12-04 23:47:53.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/monitor_metric.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_monitor_metric.py'], 'message': "Fix wrong CPU metric value in metrics_filter

CPU metrics are reported as a normalized value in [0,1].
When scheduler reads the data as MonitorMetric object, as part
of update_from_compute_node(), the value of the metric gets
lost due to a wrong type conversion, typecasting into an Integer,
reduces it to 0.

Note:
 - It may seem unintuitive that to fix the same, we are not changing
   the type of metric from Integer to Float. Please refer the
   discussions -
   * https://review.openstack.org/#/c/243825/
   * https://review.openstack.org/#/c/216923/
 - To summarize, we are trying to save some 'possible' downstream consumer
   of metrics updates from compute nodes, i.e. consuming from AMPQ, from
   software upgrade scenarios.

Change-Id: Ib504af33e05dfc4d7e97b52682e27befc67d784a
Closes-bug: #1514997
"}]
commit_message:
Fix wrong CPU metric value in metrics_filter

CPU metrics are reported as a normalized value in [0,1].
When scheduler reads the data as MonitorMetric object, as part
of update_from_compute_node(), the value of the metric gets
lost due to a wrong type conversion, typecasting into an Integer,
reduces it to 0.

Note:
 - It may seem unintuitive that to fix the same, we are not changing
   the type of metric from Integer to Float. Please refer the
   discussions -
   * https://review.openstack.org/#/c/243825/
   * https://review.openstack.org/#/c/216923/
 - To summarize, we are trying to save some 'possible' downstream consumer
   of metrics updates from compute nodes, i.e. consuming from AMPQ, from
   software upgrade scenarios.

Change-Id: Ib504af33e05dfc4d7e97b52682e27befc67d784a
Closes-bug: #1514997

commit_message:
WIP: Allow multi-attach in compute api

Modify check_attach in volume_api in order to enable the functionality
in Nova.

Boot from multiattach volume is blocked in case the 'source_type' and
'destination_type' is volume and 'boot_index' is 0 in the
block_device_mapping.

APIIMpact Enabling multiattach feature

TODO API microversion
Partially-implements: blueprint multi-attach-volume
Change-Id: I7c8ca05cb78180070ad09463e9f9c8c04b87b6b5

commit_message:
resource-providers: Scheduler filters in DB

We extend the resource-providers blueprint series to modify the
scheduler to filter compute nodes on the database side instead of
retrieving all compute nodes in the deployment and filtering on the
Python side.

Change-Id: I0f476ccca3c9037178e43022607eb531fc2ab55e
blueprint: resource-providers-scheduler-db-filters

subject: Update oslo::cache define
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-31 15:50:31.000000000', 'files': ['spec/defines/oslo_cache_spec.rb', 'manifests/cache.pp'], 'message': "Update oslo::cache define

* Fix docs for parameter
* Use only one call of create_resources
* 'memcache_servers' and 'proxies' parameter should be
  arrays (list value). So, need to convert them to
  string joined with ','.
* Prepare unit tests

Change-Id: I1a36d39bb40574e1abfb6bad3daf11a043dd0f78
"}]
commit_message:
Update oslo::cache define

* Fix docs for parameter
* Use only one call of create_resources
* 'memcache_servers' and 'proxies' parameter should be
  arrays (list value). So, need to convert them to
  string joined with ','.
* Prepare unit tests

Change-Id: I1a36d39bb40574e1abfb6bad3daf11a043dd0f78

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-19 06:18:05.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/controller.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_identity.py'], 'message': "Allow user list without specifying domain

With a single domain environment, users can be listed without
specifying a domain. When moving to a multiple domain environment,
this remains true for domain-scoped tokens but not for project-scoped
tokens. Project-scoped tokens currently only work if the domain_id
query parameter is specified. This has been a source of pain to many
users, and is unnecessary. Just as the desired domain is assumed to be
that to which the token is scoped when the token is domain-scoped,
keystone can assume the desired domain is that of the project's domain
when the token is project-scoped.

Change-Id: I1d06935c06661109a523c5b4547ff01f23235a89
Closes-Bug: 1479578
"}]
commit_message:
Allow user list without specifying domain

With a single domain environment, users can be listed without
specifying a domain. When moving to a multiple domain environment,
this remains true for domain-scoped tokens but not for project-scoped
tokens. Project-scoped tokens currently only work if the domain_id
query parameter is specified. This has been a source of pain to many
users, and is unnecessary. Just as the desired domain is assumed to be
that to which the token is scoped when the token is domain-scoped,
keystone can assume the desired domain is that of the project's domain
when the token is project-scoped.

Change-Id: I1d06935c06661109a523c5b4547ff01f23235a89
Closes-Bug: 1479578

subject: Setting default domain for V3 ListUser Identity-command
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-01 00:57:00.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/identity/v3/user.py'], 'message': "Setting default domain for V3 ListUser Identity-command

Based on keystone #1498556 is safe to assume the default domain
can be specified as default.
Setting the default domain to 'Default' for ListUser
openstack commands will fix the rather annoying issue
for end users to specify a domain even when just using
the defaults in keystone. That is particular important
when enabling multi domain drivers in Keystone and LDAP.
Lastly the Domain Id colume is added to any standard
ListUser output

Closes-Bug: #1521420
Change-Id: Ib174b7461f6f2a23b2c6f14c58756bbd816fc6bf
"}]
commit_message:
Setting default domain for V3 ListUser Identity-command

Based on keystone #1498556 is safe to assume the default domain
can be specified as default.
Setting the default domain to 'Default' for ListUser
openstack commands will fix the rather annoying issue
for end users to specify a domain even when just using
the defaults in keystone. That is particular important
when enabling multi domain drivers in Keystone and LDAP.
Lastly the Domain Id colume is added to any standard
ListUser output

Closes-Bug: #1521420
Change-Id: Ib174b7461f6f2a23b2c6f14c58756bbd816fc6bf

subject: Traceroute to git.o.o in net-info macro
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-31 15:13:03.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/macros.yaml'], 'message': "Traceroute to git.o.o in net-info macro

From time to time we see network connectivity issues from instances
to various destinations. Particularly negative impact occurs if jobs
can't reach the main git mirror, since they pretty much all need to
check it for updates to whatever repo(s) they use. It's helpful, in
these instances, to be able to provide traceroutes from the affected
instances so that our providers can diagnose potential issues within
their networks.

Change-Id: Ide9db3673bbbe25de246b33907908376e99895fd
"}]
commit_message:
Traceroute to git.o.o in net-info macro

From time to time we see network connectivity issues from instances
to various destinations. Particularly negative impact occurs if jobs
can't reach the main git mirror, since they pretty much all need to
check it for updates to whatever repo(s) they use. It's helpful, in
these instances, to be able to provide traceroutes from the affected
instances so that our providers can diagnose potential issues within
their networks.

Change-Id: Ide9db3673bbbe25de246b33907908376e99895fd

commit_message:
Fix validate_args function in cliutils

Fix validate_args() for more strict validation. Current
logic works if only 1 required arg for functions.
May fails if more than 1 required args.
Refer to bug description for example failure case.

Change-Id: Ie9bc54631d431f0933daf74793f0bcca1ba227f7
Closes-Bug: #1555764

subject: Provide Nova & Cinder the Glance API Servers
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-31 15:06:07.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/inventory/group_vars/hosts.yml'], 'message': 'Provide Nova & Cinder the Glance API Servers

Currently the Nova and Cinder roles require the Glance API server
list, but use variables outside of their namespace.

This is not good practise. This sets up namespaced group_vars for
use by both roles.

The Cinder role already expects the var [1], but a follow-on patch
will be submitted to the Nova role to also adjust its pattern.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/290856

Change-Id: I31b06aad686fcc32d55c78147e3d5d099b8cc5b9
'}]
commit_message:
Provide Nova & Cinder the Glance API Servers

Currently the Nova and Cinder roles require the Glance API server
list, but use variables outside of their namespace.

This is not good practise. This sets up namespaced group_vars for
use by both roles.

The Cinder role already expects the var [1], but a follow-on patch
will be submitted to the Nova role to also adjust its pattern.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/290856

Change-Id: I31b06aad686fcc32d55c78147e3d5d099b8cc5b9

subject: Destroy orphan objects
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-31 14:25:08.000000000', 'files': ['murano/dsl/executor.py', 'murano/common/engine.py', 'murano/dsl/serializer.py', 'murano/dsl/object_store.py', 'murano/tests/unit/dsl/foundation/runner.py'], 'message': 'Destroy orphan objects

Murano has a garbage collector that destroys objects
which were deleted in API after last deployment.
However if objects were removed from object model
during deployment (action execution) or were created
and not saved there they left unnoticed by the engine
causing resource leak.

With this change all objects that are presented in object store
but were not serialized to result object model are get destroyed.

Change-Id: I107b34e3ae4e1b5835645e116f9445535dfb7636
Closes-Bug: #1562804
'}]
commit_message:
Destroy orphan objects

Murano has a garbage collector that destroys objects
which were deleted in API after last deployment.
However if objects were removed from object model
during deployment (action execution) or were created
and not saved there they left unnoticed by the engine
causing resource leak.

With this change all objects that are presented in object store
but were not serialized to result object model are get destroyed.

Change-Id: I107b34e3ae4e1b5835645e116f9445535dfb7636
Closes-Bug: #1562804

commit_message:
Fix invalid uuids in rbd unit tests

The rbd unit tests emit a FutureWarnings [1] from
oslo_versioned_objects due to use of an invalid faked test value.

This commit uses values from cinder/tests/unit/fake_constants.py to
resolve this issue.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.versionedobjects/api/fields.html#oslo_versionedobjects.fields.UUIDField

Murano has a garbage collector that destroys objects
which were deleted in API after last deployment.
However if objects were removed from object model
during deployment (action execution) or were created
and not saved there they left unnoticed by the engine
causing resource leak.

With this change all objects that are presented in object store
but were not serialized to result object model are get destroyed.

Change-Id: I107b34e3ae4e1b5835645e116f9445535dfb7636
Closes-Bug: #1562804

commit_message:
Don't use bash eval for Linux.runCommand

Linux.runCommand method used to pass script
in a command line argument and evaluated it using
"eval". This approach failed when the script contained
input redirection.

With this fix script is passed as a file which is specified
as an entry point in execution plan.
Also we supported explicit files in execution plan but not
for the script entry point. This was fixed as well.

Change-Id: Ifd15fc57b08e33ed61cd2765613cd705ce12a5f2
Closes-Bug: #1562954

commit_message:
Don't use bash eval for Linux.runCommand

Linux.runCommand method used to pass script
in a command line argument and evaluated it using
"eval". This approach failed when the script contained
input redirection.

With this fix script is passed as a file which is specified
as an entry point in execution plan.
Also we supported explicit files in execution plan but not
for the script entry point. This was fixed as well.

Change-Id: Ifd15fc57b08e33ed61cd2765613cd705ce12a5f2
Closes-Bug: #1562954

commit_message:
Enable volume owners to execute migrate_volume_completion

When non admin user executes nova swap volume function,
a cinder-api returns a 403 error to nova by default.
So the default setting in cinder policy.json has been changed
to 'rule:admin_or_owner' instead of 'rule:admin_api'.

DocImpact
Change-Id: Id356c1503d630e31b53a8f66ad207d8dd8cdad7e
Closes-Bug: #1522705

subject: Fix folded header checks for WebOb
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-31 13:03:24.000000000', 'files': ['microversion_parse/__init__.py', 'test-requirements.txt', 'microversion_parse/tests/test_webob.py'], 'message': "Fix folded header checks for WebOb

WebOb uses a Mapping class for headers which behaves like a dict
but does not inherit from dict, so the isinstance check in
fold_headers was not working as expected. This is now replaced
with a check for dict-like behaviors. It's a bit of a tossup
between doing a hasattr and simply trying to access a key. I chose
the former for readability and because we don't actually want to
do anything with the value we would retrieve were access by a key
legit.

Tests are added to specfically cover the use of a
webob.headers.EnvironHeaders object, which is what headers in
Nova and Nova derivations look like.

Change-Id: I31de49bcfd8822c53d3293b106de96138eaf4464
"}]
commit_message:
Fix folded header checks for WebOb

WebOb uses a Mapping class for headers which behaves like a dict
but does not inherit from dict, so the isinstance check in
fold_headers was not working as expected. This is now replaced
with a check for dict-like behaviors. It's a bit of a tossup
between doing a hasattr and simply trying to access a key. I chose
the former for readability and because we don't actually want to
do anything with the value we would retrieve were access by a key
legit.

Tests are added to specfically cover the use of a
webob.headers.EnvironHeaders object, which is what headers in
Nova and Nova derivations look like.

Change-Id: I31de49bcfd8822c53d3293b106de96138eaf4464

commit_message:
Partitoner references invalid exception class

The partitioner references an non-existent exception. Additionally,
the exception it intended to catch was *extremely* generic, and it's
attempted recovery was flawed. It should be save to fix that all up
in this review, as this code has never actually be executed.

Change-Id: Ib3e885baa03ea7de0a23f8b4aaed5feb2ea4e234
Closes-Bug: 1560950

subject: Allow the use of cinder_glance_host or cinder_glance_api_servers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-31 15:19:40.000000000', 'files': ['templates/cinder.conf.j2'], 'message': 'Allow the use of cinder_glance_host or cinder_glance_api_servers

Change Iad691c32a6eafa2cddee29659a74df142240b142 implemented the use of the
correct option for Cinder to contact the Glance API servers, but this was
done without first ensuring that the integrated build included the
appropriate variable to action it. The integrated gate is broken as a result
of this.

This patch allows either configuration to be used which will allow the
integrated gate to continue working until the appropriate patch has merged.

Change-Id: I404bf891ded25b54a808013da5df3a20d676f907
'}]
commit_message:
Allow the use of cinder_glance_host or cinder_glance_api_servers

Change Iad691c32a6eafa2cddee29659a74df142240b142 implemented the use of the
correct option for Cinder to contact the Glance API servers, but this was
done without first ensuring that the integrated build included the
appropriate variable to action it. The integrated gate is broken as a result
of this.

This patch allows either configuration to be used which will allow the
integrated gate to continue working until the appropriate patch has merged.

Change-Id: I404bf891ded25b54a808013da5df3a20d676f907

revisions:
[{'number': 18, 'created': '2016-03-18 19:02:51.000000000', 'files': ['manila/tests/share/test_api.py', 'manila/db/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'manila/share/api.py', 'manila/tests/share/test_access.py', 'manila/share/manager.py', 'manila/common/constants.py', 'manila/share/access.py', 'manila/tests/share/test_manager.py'], 'message': "Fix update_access concurrency issue

With the new update_access interface, concurrent requests to allow
access might get lost when the driver takes a long time to process
the new rules. This patch fixes this issue by verifying for the
existence of new unprocessed rules at the end of the update_access
method.

APIImpact
access_allow action on shares with access_rules_status 'out_of_sync'
was previously disallowed with HTTPBadRequest. Now, the action is
disallowed only for shares with access_rules_status set to 'error'.

Change-Id: I0f863cbae4d8af0660114161deda7bf7aa60d71d
Closes-bug: #1550295
"}]
commit_message:
Fix update_access concurrency issue

With the new update_access interface, concurrent requests to allow
access might get lost when the driver takes a long time to process
the new rules. This patch fixes this issue by verifying for the
existence of new unprocessed rules at the end of the update_access
method.

APIImpact
access_allow action on shares with access_rules_status 'out_of_sync'
was previously disallowed with HTTPBadRequest. Now, the action is
disallowed only for shares with access_rules_status set to 'error'.

Change-Id: I0f863cbae4d8af0660114161deda7bf7aa60d71d
Closes-bug: #1550295

subject: Fixing updating user with no default project
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-03-30 18:22:34.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/identity/users/tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/identity/users/forms.py'], 'message': 'Fixing updating user with no default project

The selector for setting the default project passes on an empty string
if the value is not changed. This is causing an error from keystone as
an empty string is not a valid project ID.

To fix, a couple of things have been done:

First, as user_update is a PATCH, we no longer pass on the default
project as a parameter in the update when using keystone v3
and the value did not change when editing the user.

Second, there is currently no way to unset the default project
using keystoneclient. An entry in the default project select
"select a project" has been removed when the default project is
already set. The entry was selectable and resulted in the
problematic empty string. The current default project is already
selected at load time. The ability to select a different default
project is maintained.

Additionally, keystone v2.0 functionality is not effected, as the
default project id is required in v2.0.

A test was added to cover the case of editing the default project.

Closes-Bug: #1561612
Change-Id: I3c84ee5c7af846b5a58f2dd0342a537d312323cf
(cherry picked from commit 32510d8211a43d83ebac6478fce17a8856cf9a0c)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixing updating user with no default project

The selector for setting the default project passes on an empty string
if the value is not changed. This is causing an error from keystone as
an empty string is not a valid project ID.

To fix, a couple of things have been done:

First, as user_update is a PATCH, we no longer pass on the default
project as a parameter in the update when using keystone v3
and the value did not change when editing the user.

Second, there is currently no way to unset the default project
using keystoneclient. An entry in the default project select
"select a project" has been removed when the default project is
already set. The entry was selectable and resulted in the
problematic empty string. The current default project is already
selected at load time. The ability to select a different default
project is maintained.

Additionally, keystone v2.0 functionality is not effected, as the
default project id is required in v2.0.

A test was added to cover the case of editing the default project.

Closes-Bug: #1561612
Change-Id: I3c84ee5c7af846b5a58f2dd0342a537d312323cf
(cherry picked from commit 32510d8211a43d83ebac6478fce17a8856cf9a0c)

Change-Id: Iae071e1bc19f20b38cc380e37366184b15ae7088

commit_message:
bagpipe: skip network:* ports and external networks ports

With this change, bagpipe driver won't trigger agent
RPCs for any network:* port or port of external networks.

This was already done for DHCP ports, but extended to
router interfaces, gateway interfaces, and external
networks.

The documentation and unit tests are updated accordingly.

Change-Id: Iae071e1bc19f20b38cc380e37366184b15ae7088

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-31 09:25:15.000000000', 'files': ['tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/main.yml', 'tests/roles/bootstrap-host/defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Add var to control MongoDB user creation

Add the var bootstrap_host_mongodb_users to allow the MongoDB user
creation tasks in the bootstrap-host role to be skipped using the
BOOTSTRAP_OPTS environment variable defined in the script
bootstrap-aio.sh.

The default value for bootstrap_host_mongodb_users is the value of
bootstrap_host_mongodb_service.

Without this change setting bootstrap_host_mongodb_service=no causes the
bootstrap-host role to fail on the task 'Add ceilometer database user'.

Change-Id: Iab30ed29f1bc1a922e5adf89b1057c598ec067e3
(cherry picked from commit 318109d0ed5087fa3357e2a02d848e0619f879ee)
"}]
commit_message:
Add var to control MongoDB user creation

Add the var bootstrap_host_mongodb_users to allow the MongoDB user
creation tasks in the bootstrap-host role to be skipped using the
BOOTSTRAP_OPTS environment variable defined in the script
bootstrap-aio.sh.

The default value for bootstrap_host_mongodb_users is the value of
bootstrap_host_mongodb_service.

Without this change setting bootstrap_host_mongodb_service=no causes the
bootstrap-host role to fail on the task 'Add ceilometer database user'.

Change-Id: Iab30ed29f1bc1a922e5adf89b1057c598ec067e3
(cherry picked from commit 318109d0ed5087fa3357e2a02d848e0619f879ee)

commit_message:
Synchronize port handling

At the moment, the thread workers handling ports seem to enter a
deadlock in some cases.

Attempting to avoid this kind of issues, this patch synchronizes
the port handling operations based on the port id.

Partial-Bug: #1564344

Change-Id: Ic4439bcdaff59e08dfdc903551fe7c0510109cbf

commit_message:
Correct openrc script for zsh

print a WARNING message to stdout, it will break the zsh script
in faq.rst. This patch redirect openrc output to /dev/null.

commit_message:
Fix DB unit tests in the western hemisphere

The commit 77a36ec519e2eff9814ed0fb01050b582b9fd021 changed
purge_deleted to (correctly) calculate the age of stacks using UTC
rather than local time, but the unit tests were not modified accordingly
with the result that they failed when run in time zones with substantial
negative offsets from UTC.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-30 16:24:22.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_federation.py'], 'message': 'Random project should return positive numbers

The function random.randint(a, b) returns a random
number such that a <= N <= b .[0]

Since this test is returning random numbers such that
0 <= N <= len(projects)
It is possible to be subtracting 1 from 0 returning a random
number of -1.

Luckily Python is smart and allows the user to pass a negative number
as a index of a list to get the elements starting from  the right side :)
Which is technically not breaking anything and getting the same out
come, but we should probably do it correctly.

[0]: https://docs.python.org/2/library/random.html#random.randint

Change-Id: I63949aafd40f14d471f3fecf2895235254f36017
'}]
commit_message:
Random project should return positive numbers

The function random.randint(a, b) returns a random
number such that a <= N <= b .[0]

Since this test is returning random numbers such that
0 <= N <= len(projects)
It is possible to be subtracting 1 from 0 returning a random
number of -1.

Luckily Python is smart and allows the user to pass a negative number
as a index of a list to get the elements starting from  the right side :)
Which is technically not breaking anything and getting the same out
come, but we should probably do it correctly.

[0]: https://docs.python.org/2/library/random.html#random.randint

Change-Id: I63949aafd40f14d471f3fecf2895235254f36017

commit_message:
Dell SC: Error results moved to json

The Dell SC REST response test field is now encapsulated in json.
So login has to first get the result value before parsing the error.

Closes-Bug: #1559269

commit_message:
Fix mysql hash lookup for deep hash merge

hiera_hash('mysql_hash') only pulls in the
mysql_hash from globals.yaml, ignoring the
'mysql' hash that exists in plugins.

This is part of a fix that will align all hash
storage and lookups to not contain '_hash' suffix.

Change-Id: Id74f6b31107f8939f185b3832c897d3dff7197f9
Partial-Bug: #1526917
(cherry picked from commit d73af357ce11bc2f5b1d6c4bdd0f8f5d43c56bb0)

subject: Use journald when it is present
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-30 23:56:52.000000000', 'files': ['functions.sh'], 'message': "Use journald when it is present

Previously we only assumed journald was present on fedora, but now it
exists on centos7 and ubuntu xenial. Instead of using the distro to
determine if journald is present test for the presence of journalctl.

If we don't hvae a journalctl fall back to the old behavior and assume
rsyslog is in use.

Change-Id: I4e1a3bdda7d46722b0a16ebb0b442917d4cb9b78
"}]
commit_message:
Use journald when it is present

Previously we only assumed journald was present on fedora, but now it
exists on centos7 and ubuntu xenial. Instead of using the distro to
determine if journald is present test for the presence of journalctl.

If we don't hvae a journalctl fall back to the old behavior and assume
rsyslog is in use.

Change-Id: I4e1a3bdda7d46722b0a16ebb0b442917d4cb9b78

commit_message:
Cleanup stale OVS flows for physical bridges

Perform deletion of the stale flows in physical bridges consistently with
br-int and br-tun, respecting drop_flows_on_start configuration option.
Added tests for auxiliary bridge and functional tests for the physical
bridge using VLAN/flat external network. Fixes part of the bug 1514056;
together with [1] and [2], the bug should be considered fixed.

The commit also fixes inconsistency between netmask of allocated IP
addresses assigned in _create_test_port_dict and ip_len in _plug_ports
of base.py.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/297211/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/297818/

Co-Authored-By: Jian Wen <wenjianhn@gmail.com>
Partial-Bug: 1514056

subject: Fix some unexpected tracebacks while running tox tests

When run in fake more, the task manager isn't properly handling
exceptions that can be thrown, and since negative tests can cause
exceptions to be thrown, we get annoying tox tests.

really going on.

commit_message:
Fix some unexpected tracebacks while running tox tests

When run in fake more, the task manager isn't properly handling
exceptions that can be thrown, and since negative tests can cause
exceptions to be thrown, we get annoying tox tests.

This fix cleans up the output of tox tests and let's you see what's
really going on.

Change-Id: I372d5e299deddc868ef5bfba81c7eeeda9f44b72
Closes-Bug: 1378083
Author: Robert Myers <robert.myers@RACKSPACE.COM>
Co-Authored-By: Amrith Kumar <amrith@tesora.com>

Before creating the overcloud, the ctlplane subnet might be updated

commit_message:
Added validation to tripleo.sh --overcloud-deploy option.

Before creating the overcloud, the ctlplane subnet might be updated
with a valid and reachable DNS server, this validation check if is
configured, if not, it will assign the current DNS server from the
undercloud, is not configured with 8.8.8.8 as it might be restricted from
some locations.

Change-Id: I7ba40735ff9157e4ee8870914b0240fe9f95debc

commit_message:
Calm down try,except,pass and try,except,continue

These tests default to the strict setting, this is quite noisy and
normally produces false positives. Probably not a good default, so
this calms down these tests.

Change-Id: Ia22569bdae1705a2a499ad17bbfffdf211e9d2b2

commit_message:
Fix gate by adding MariaDB-shared dependnecy

With the reorganization of the MariaDB repository, the C libraries
for mariadb were not included in the toolbox container.  This results
in a non-functional CentOS environment which is resolved by this
simple patch.

Change-Id: Ib4a2f7e55b6efc36bc3ff2d93447cb97b7b109f5
Closes-Bug: #1561347
(cherry picked from commit 5f381dfbdd6509601e18655815022c340548a03d)

subject: Fix gate to use world writeable docker socket
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2834, 'name': 'Steven Dake', 'email': 'steven.dake@gmail.com', 'username': 'sdake'}, {'_account_id': 3098, 'name': 'Jeff Peeler', 'email': 'jpeeler@redhat.com', 'username': 'jpeeler-z'}, {'_account_id': 7488, 'name': 'Jeffrey Zhang', 'email': 'zhang.lei.fly@gmail.com', 'username': 'Jeffrey4l'}, {'_account_id': 11105, 'name': 'Swapnil Kulkarni', 'email': 'coolsvap@gmail.com', 'username': 'coolsvap'}, {'_account_id': 13642, 'name': 'Vikram Hosakote', 'email': 'vikram.ganesh@gmail.com', 'username': 'vhosakot'}, {'_account_id': 14027, 'name': 'Michal Rostecki', 'email': 'mrostecki@suse.de', 'username': 'mrostecki'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-31 09:10:02.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini', 'tools/setup_nodes.yml'], 'message': "Fix gate to use world writeable docker socket

A recent change related to sudo securepath broke how sudo -E
works.  Now the PATH is reset by sudo as set by tox.  As a result
we can no longer rely on sudo -E anywhere in our gating system
relating to path inheritence from the parent shell.

This patch uses a shell operation in the setup_nodes.yml code
to chmod the docker socket to 666 so docker containers can build
properly.  Now docker operations don't return a permission denied
and we no longer require the sudo -E operation in any of our tox
scripts.  This isn't a security vulnerability because our gate
scripts are only meant to be run in OpenStack infrastructure.
To make this more clear I recommend moving these shell scripts to
tests/gate.

Change-Id: I5b3d6e280e3c12a25defedb14b5589ba642043fa
Closes-Bug: #1562383
"}]
commit_message:
Fix gate to use world writeable docker socket

A recent change related to sudo securepath broke how sudo -E
works.  Now the PATH is reset by sudo as set by tox.  As a result
we can no longer rely on sudo -E anywhere in our gating system
relating to path inheritence from the parent shell.

This patch uses a shell operation in the setup_nodes.yml code
to chmod the docker socket to 666 so docker containers can build
properly.  Now docker operations don't return a permission denied
and we no longer require the sudo -E operation in any of our tox
scripts.  This isn't a security vulnerability because our gate
scripts are only meant to be run in OpenStack infrastructure.
To make this more clear I recommend moving these shell scripts to
tests/gate.

Change-Id: I5b3d6e280e3c12a25defedb14b5589ba642043fa
Closes-Bug: #1562383

Glare (aka Glance Artifact Repository) is a new service which
is marketed as an improved Glance.

Glare offers its users a number of important features, like:
 * Custom assets — it's not just images anymore, but also Heat
   templates, Murano packages, Mistral workbooks, Tacker
   blueprints and so on.
 * Artifacts versioning — each artifact can be supplemented
   with the version in SemVer format.
 * Support of multiple binary objects per artifact — currently
   an image contains only one binary attribute - ‘file’. From
   Glare’s part, it allows you to specify a set of such attributes.

   properties like ‘dict’, ‘list’ and 'set'.
 * Dependencies between artifacts — one artifact may depend on
   the other.
 * Additional filtering for artifacts with various operators.
 * Importing/exporting of artifacts between clouds.

Change-Id: Ia8332f5caa396ecccc1bdddce7b782cdaf7298e6
Co-Authored-By: Kairat Kushaev <kkushaev@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Darja Shakhray <dshakhray@mirantis.com>
"}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Glare

Glare (aka Glance Artifact Repository) is a new service which
is marketed as an improved Glance.

Glare offers its users a number of important features, like:
 * Custom assets — it's not just images anymore, but also Heat
   templates, Murano packages, Mistral workbooks, Tacker
   blueprints and so on.
 * Artifacts versioning — each artifact can be supplemented
   with the version in SemVer format.
 * Support of multiple binary objects per artifact — currently
   an image contains only one binary attribute - ‘file’. From
   Glare’s part, it allows you to specify a set of such attributes.
 * Structured properties — artifacts may contain structured
   properties like ‘dict’, ‘list’ and 'set'.
 * Dependencies between artifacts — one artifact may depend on
   the other.
 * Additional filtering for artifacts with various operators.
 * Importing/exporting of artifacts between clouds.

Change-Id: Ia8332f5caa396ecccc1bdddce7b782cdaf7298e6
Co-Authored-By: Kairat Kushaev <kkushaev@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Darja Shakhray <dshakhray@mirantis.com>

subject: Fix version output of absolute requirements
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-31 09:42:43.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/repo_build/templates/requirements_absolute_requirements.txt.j2'], 'message': "Fix version output of absolute requirements

Fix the requirements_absolute_requirements.txt.j2 template so that the
versions are correctly translated for Pip. Prior to this version a Pip
version ending with '.postx' is incorrectly added to the file, e.g

Without this patch the following is added, that is not valid:
functools32==3.2.3_2

With this patch the same version would be output as:
functools32==3.2.3.post2

Change-Id: I57321f71b0e04de76ec1e15d0e82d2fc03b83830
"}]
commit_message:
Fix version output of absolute requirements

Fix the requirements_absolute_requirements.txt.j2 template so that the
versions are correctly translated for Pip. Prior to this version a Pip
version ending with '.postx' is incorrectly added to the file, e.g

Without this patch the following is added, that is not valid:
functools32==3.2.3_2

With this patch the same version would be output as:
functools32==3.2.3.post2

Change-Id: I57321f71b0e04de76ec1e15d0e82d2fc03b83830

commit_message:
Convergence: Ignore not found when releasing lock

When releasing a lock on resource, ignore the not found exception.
Basically, handle situations where resource is deleted with with lock
held.

subject: Fix Newton schedule
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-31 11:40:45.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/newton/schedule.rst'], 'message': "Fix Newton schedule

Proposed Newton schedule has two 'Oct 10-14' weeks (at R+0 and R+1)
so we need to fix this.

Ideal Summit date is at R+3, and Ocata is likely to be a short cycle
already, so moving the release date to October 6 (instead of October
13) sounds like our best bet.

Change-Id: I0b246ba6bf7341500756068689eea4ee33bb0fcb
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Newton schedule

Proposed Newton schedule has two 'Oct 10-14' weeks (at R+0 and R+1)
so we need to fix this.

Ideal Summit date is at R+3, and Ocata is likely to be a short cycle
already, so moving the release date to October 6 (instead of October
13) sounds like our best bet.

Change-Id: I0b246ba6bf7341500756068689eea4ee33bb0fcb

("ResourceAllocator") in error messages when exclusive resource
allocation fails.

subject: Add var to control MongoDB user creation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-31 09:27:11.000000000', 'files': ['tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/main.yml', 'tests/roles/bootstrap-host/defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Add var to control MongoDB user creation

Add the var bootstrap_host_mongodb_users to allow the MongoDB user
creation tasks in the bootstrap-host role to be skipped using the
BOOTSTRAP_OPTS environment variable defined in the script
bootstrap-aio.sh.

The default value for bootstrap_host_mongodb_users is the value of
bootstrap_host_mongodb_service.

Without this change setting bootstrap_host_mongodb_service=no causes the
bootstrap-host role to fail on the task 'Add ceilometer database user'.

Change-Id: Iab30ed29f1bc1a922e5adf89b1057c598ec067e3
(cherry picked from commit 318109d0ed5087fa3357e2a02d848e0619f879ee)
"}]
commit_message:
Add var to control MongoDB user creation

Add the var bootstrap_host_mongodb_users to allow the MongoDB user
creation tasks in the bootstrap-host role to be skipped using the
BOOTSTRAP_OPTS environment variable defined in the script
bootstrap-aio.sh.

The default value for bootstrap_host_mongodb_users is the value of
bootstrap_host_mongodb_service.

Without this change setting bootstrap_host_mongodb_service=no causes the
bootstrap-host role to fail on the task 'Add ceilometer database user'.

Change-Id: Iab30ed29f1bc1a922e5adf89b1057c598ec067e3
(cherry picked from commit 318109d0ed5087fa3357e2a02d848e0619f879ee)

subject: Conductor changes to register nova-powervm objects
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-31 13:58:01.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/tests/cmd/__init__.py', 'nova_powervm/cmd/__init__.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/cmd/test_conductor.py', 'README.rst', 'setup.cfg', 'nova_powervm/cmd/conductor.py'], 'message': 'Conductor changes to register nova-powervm objects

Nova now sends the LiveMigrateData objects exclusively to
pass data between compute managers and conductor during live
migration. Since dicts are no longer supported the conversion
to objects must be done to continue to support live migration.

A previous change set added the object support to the nova-powervm
project.  This change set adds the hack (as the nova core team described
to the PowerVM team on Feb 24th in IRC) that enables operators to use a
custom conductor that supports the PowerVM live migrate object.

Change-Id: I2517d543cc66696a43b2cdb160e2452653f402f1
Closes-Bug: #1551954
(cherry picked from commit c3ce18868e9af2def675c294b1e789da501cfe04)
'}]
commit_message:
Conductor changes to register nova-powervm objects

Nova now sends the LiveMigrateData objects exclusively to
pass data between compute managers and conductor during live
migration. Since dicts are no longer supported the conversion
to objects must be done to continue to support live migration.

A previous change set added the object support to the nova-powervm
project.  This change set adds the hack (as the nova core team described
to the PowerVM team on Feb 24th in IRC) that enables operators to use a
custom conductor that supports the PowerVM live migrate object.

Change-Id: I2517d543cc66696a43b2cdb160e2452653f402f1
Closes-Bug: #1551954
(cherry picked from commit c3ce18868e9af2def675c294b1e789da501cfe04)

commit_message:
Add sample API content

This adds sample API content for versions and servers resources,
including the parameters.yaml that is needed in both of these cases.

It also makes a new tox.ini target 'api-ref' for building these docs,
which will be used as part of the publishing pipeline.

Change-Id: I310ed352dc5dd81d01f2fd5f1a2fab662c29f0dc

commit_message:
Change license for late_command.py to Apache

licensed, so should be all files. This file
late_command.py was originally motivated by
similar ideas used in Cobbler community.

Since there is no equivalent of a force-snapshot-delete,
the normal snapshot-delete should be more robust to
also handle backend errors. In case the backend does not have
the image snapshot anymore, log an info message and succeed the
operation.

Change-Id: I7fe0878dbc07053ac78272b6998513fafa1c36e8
Closes-Bug: #1415905
Related-Bug: #1361926
'}]
commit_message:
RBD: Make snapshot_delete more robust

Since there is no equivalent of a force-snapshot-delete,
the normal snapshot-delete should be more robust to
also handle backend errors. In case the backend does not have
the image snapshot anymore, log an info message and succeed the
operation.

Change-Id: I7fe0878dbc07053ac78272b6998513fafa1c36e8
Closes-Bug: #1415905
Related-Bug: #1361926

subject: Cache ports like servers
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-31 00:12:20.000000000', 'files': ['shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': "Cache ports like servers

This implements nearly the same caching logic for ports as servers
so that when nodepool has a lot of servers that need floating ips,
we can potentially list all of the ports and get the ports for many
servers with one API call.

If a filter is being pushed down to neutron, we will just perform
the API call rather than caching (but in the common case of searching
for a port for a server, we will no longer push down the filter
in order to allow the caching to happen).

Since we could have a caching delay, we also wait a little bit
in case we don't get a port when we expect one.

Change-Id: I66566f7a84d50b562f1303ed0e645cb41b11367e
"}]
commit_message:
Cache ports like servers

This implements nearly the same caching logic for ports as servers
so that when nodepool has a lot of servers that need floating ips,
we can potentially list all of the ports and get the ports for many
servers with one API call.

If a filter is being pushed down to neutron, we will just perform
the API call rather than caching (but in the common case of searching
for a port for a server, we will no longer push down the filter
in order to allow the caching to happen).

Since we could have a caching delay, we also wait a little bit
in case we don't get a port when we expect one.

Change-Id: I66566f7a84d50b562f1303ed0e645cb41b11367e

subject: New workaround for Glance,Murano,Heat auth token expiry
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-31 01:31:52.000000000', 'files': ['congress/datasources/heatv1_driver.py', 'congress/datasources/glancev2_driver.py', 'congress/datasources/murano_driver.py'], 'message': "New workaround for Glance,Murano,Heat auth token expiry

Glance client continues to use old auth token after refresh.
New workaround creates a whole new glance client instance with
new token.

Also changed program flow so that further 401 error after token
refresh are surfaced. The fact that 401 errors after token refresh
were suppressed was probably why the bug wasn't caught much earlier.

Same fix applied to Heat and Murano.

Change-Id: If628528c246090073fde1390e20a60e262b4ebbf
Partial-Bug: #1563495
"}]
commit_message:
New workaround for Glance,Murano,Heat auth token expiry

Glance client continues to use old auth token after refresh.
New workaround creates a whole new glance client instance with
new token.

Also changed program flow so that further 401 error after token
refresh are surfaced. The fact that 401 errors after token refresh
were suppressed was probably why the bug wasn't caught much earlier.

Same fix applied to Heat and Murano.

Change-Id: If628528c246090073fde1390e20a60e262b4ebbf
Partial-Bug: #1563495

commit_message:
Conductor changes to register nova-powervm objects

Nova now sends the LiveMigrateData objects exclusively to
pass data between compute managers and conductor during live
migration. Since dicts are no longer supported the conversion
to objects must be done to continue to support live migration.

A previous change set added the object support to the nova-powervm
project.  This change set adds the hack (as the nova core team described
to the PowerVM team on Feb 24th in IRC) that enables operators to use a
custom conductor that supports the PowerVM live migrate object.

Change-Id: I2517d543cc66696a43b2cdb160e2452653f402f1
Closes-Bug: #1551954

Ironic. Make it configurable brings flexibility to those who are

The demo user by default has both the demo and invisible_to_admin
projects associated with it. Without a default project being set,
services that want project scoped user tasks, have to just pick first
one that works.
One example of the project scope being used is how Horizon shows
only project relevant information. This is switchable via a dropdown at

commit_message:
Set the default project for the demo user

The demo user by default has both the demo and invisible_to_admin
projects associated with it. Without a default project being set,
services that want project scoped user tasks, have to just pick first
one that works.
One example of the project scope being used is how Horizon shows
only project relevant information. This is switchable via a dropdown at
the top of the screen.

Currently Horizon does not have support for using the default project upon
the initial login, tracked with
bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1455976

Change-Id: I2f69d61a112ee56b8be9cd1e14557c2624ea4e07
Related-Bug: #1455976

commit_message:
Add hardening support

Add charmhelpers.contrib.hardening and calls to install,
config-changed, upgrade-charm and update-status hooks.
Also add new config option to allow one or more hardening
modules to be applied at runtime.

Change-Id: I46e1b43df3a5e59018f604ce1ae20bd62744a45b

subject: [sahara-tests] create and merge, disable tests
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-31 08:03:38.000000000', 'files': ['gerrit/acls/openstack/sahara-tests.config', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': '[sahara-tests] create and merge, disable tests

These _temporary_ changes should allow sahara-tests-release to:
- create a new, orphan branch where to push a series of (imported)
  commits from another repositories;
- push a merge commit from the said orphan branch to master for proper
  review;
- disable the tests from being executed (exception: the required basic
  tests).

The first draft of the complete plan was outlined here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-March/089929.html

Change-Id: I72b8e0b777573fb8249c052ecfbfd213bcc87a93
'}]
commit_message:
[sahara-tests] create and merge, disable tests

These _temporary_ changes should allow sahara-tests-release to:
- create a new, orphan branch where to push a series of (imported)
  commits from another repositories;
- push a merge commit from the said orphan branch to master for proper
  review;
- disable the tests from being executed (exception: the required basic
  tests).

The first draft of the complete plan was outlined here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-March/089929.html

The call GET /projects/{project_id}?subtree_as_list returns an ordered
list of projects in the subtree by using the breadth-first search

commit_message:
Clarify projects subtree as list option docs

The call GET /projects/{project_id}?subtree_as_list returns an ordered
list of projects in the subtree by using the breadth-first search
algorithm.

The docs didn't say that, and this patches adds this information.

Change-Id: Ia925de0ab4018b15db16dd181f2fe7474117dbf2

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-29 00:14:55.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/agents_db.py'], 'message': 'Retry updating agents table in case of deadlock

Updating agents table is contantious operation which
can fail often if mysql backend is in multimaster mode.
This could lead to agents flapping and various issues
such as sporadic reschedluing, port binding failures, etc.

Change-Id: Ief392f9a09d86c185dc086055d2cbc1891ff1d7f
Closes-Bug: #1560724
'}]
commit_message:
Retry updating agents table in case of deadlock

Updating agents table is contantious operation which
can fail often if mysql backend is in multimaster mode.
This could lead to agents flapping and various issues
such as sporadic reschedluing, port binding failures, etc.

Change-Id: Ief392f9a09d86c185dc086055d2cbc1891ff1d7f
Closes-Bug: #1560724

commit_message:
Add hardening support

Add charmhelpers.contrib.hardening and calls to install,
config-changed, upgrade-charm and update-status hooks. Also
add new config option to allow one or more hardening
modules to be applied at runtime.

Change-Id: I69c132b95290faa2cf14accb5e024f98b5aa9c6b

subject: Support for Nuage Neutron plugin in puppet-neutron
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-30 18:34:01.000000000', 'files': ['spec/unit/provider/neutron_plugin_nuage/ini_setting_spec.rb', 'spec/classes/neutron_plugins_nuage_spec.rb', 'manifests/init.pp', 'manifests/params.pp', 'manifests/plugins/nuage.pp', 'lib/puppet/provider/neutron_plugin_nuage/ini_setting.rb', 'manifests/config.pp', 'lib/puppet/type/neutron_plugin_nuage.rb'], 'message': 'Support for Nuage Neutron plugin in puppet-neutron

* manifests/plugins/nuage.pp
  ** Nuage Neutron plugin is a monolithic Neutron plugin (core_plugin in
     neutron.conf can be set to nuage).
  ** The plugin.ini file for the Nuage Neutron plugin needs to be created
     with correct properties for the Neutron service to come up
     (configured in manifests/plugins/nuage.pp).
  ** To add the configuration parameters to the plugin.ini file a custom
     resource type has been created (neutron_plugins_nuage).
* init.pp
  ** Just comment addition that core_plugin=nuage is now supported
     by puppet-neutron
* params.pp
  ** Parameterizing names of Nuage Neutron Plugin
     (pattern based on existing midonet code)
* config.pp
  ** Call to create_resource similar to other plugins
* Spec tests
  ** spec tests for the plugin/nuage.pp

The associated spec tests and custom types and providers
have also been added. This follows the same pattern as other plugins
such as midonet and opencontrail.

Change-Id: I0f092bf437739cac0b328822022e932fe5d1c6f2
(cherry picked from commit d4340331aa4fa6b70cd0123a37c74e814d9ef443)
'}]
commit_message:
Support for Nuage Neutron plugin in puppet-neutron

* manifests/plugins/nuage.pp
  ** Nuage Neutron plugin is a monolithic Neutron plugin (core_plugin in
     neutron.conf can be set to nuage).
  ** The plugin.ini file for the Nuage Neutron plugin needs to be created
     with correct properties for the Neutron service to come up
     (configured in manifests/plugins/nuage.pp).
  ** To add the configuration parameters to the plugin.ini file a custom
     resource type has been created (neutron_plugins_nuage).
* init.pp
  ** Just comment addition that core_plugin=nuage is now supported
     by puppet-neutron
* params.pp
  ** Parameterizing names of Nuage Neutron Plugin
     (pattern based on existing midonet code)
* config.pp
  ** Call to create_resource similar to other plugins
* Spec tests
  ** spec tests for the plugin/nuage.pp

The associated spec tests and custom types and providers
have also been added. This follows the same pattern as other plugins
such as midonet and opencontrail.

Change-Id: I0f092bf437739cac0b328822022e932fe5d1c6f2
(cherry picked from commit d4340331aa4fa6b70cd0123a37c74e814d9ef443)

commit_message:
Wait for neutron events when using xen driver

Commit bfb28fcf9031af4c695177663702ce05edbbfa4d removed
the VIR_DOMAIN_START_PAUSED flag for drivers that didn't
support it. Anyway those drivers should still wait for
the vif_plugged event to spawn instances correctly.

Change-Id: I4f7a2001410dc6682bcf80f87f0dfba987ae572b
Closes-bug: #1543598

commit_message:
Update help message for node tasks

Help message must provide correct task names. This patch
changes post_deployment task to post_deployment_start and
pre_deployment to pre_deployment_end.

Closes-bug: #1551904
Change-Id: If317092bc1562a74e0f2702b73c7c3fb88a11164

commit_message:
[Reports] Move angular directive to separate file

This patch moves angular directive "widget", which is used
for rendering charts widgets, into separate template file.

The deirective will be re-used by upcoming trends report,
so we move this shared code into common place.

Blueprint: trends-report
Change-Id: I963c6e4b1dbaf76dfca656b472e732f4854b35cb

The LoggingVolumeDriver will be useful in functional tests where
the backend volume being created is not important, for example the
nested quota Tempest tests. To allow volume creation, this driver
should report stats so that the scheduler will consider this backend
during volume creation.

Change-Id: I02fc02b7e4d9d6b7fec0a288fc34e2365ddcd9fd
Closes-Bug: #1554209
'}]
commit_message:
Add get_volume_stats for LoggingVolumeDriver

The LoggingVolumeDriver will be useful in functional tests where
the backend volume being created is not important, for example the
nested quota Tempest tests. To allow volume creation, this driver
should report stats so that the scheduler will consider this backend
during volume creation.

Change-Id: I02fc02b7e4d9d6b7fec0a288fc34e2365ddcd9fd
Closes-Bug: #1554209

subject: Add an option to enable cleaning
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-07 17:34:31.000000000', 'files': ['undercloud.conf.sample', 'instack_undercloud/undercloud.py', 'elements/puppet-stack-config/install.d/02-puppet-stack-config', 'elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.yaml.template'], 'message': "Add an option to enable cleaning

Ironic supports automatic cleaning before and between deployments. With the IPA
image it wipes the hard drive, but may potentially do other tasks returning a
node to a clean state. We have it disabled by default, as it's time-consuming
and our bulk introspection operation does not account for it. However, there is
a valid use case for cleaning, so this patch adds an option to enable it.

Change-Id: Id4946ee08c67610aae4c28e5d28056105e2c0c84
"}]
commit_message:
Add an option to enable cleaning

Ironic supports automatic cleaning before and between deployments. With the IPA
image it wipes the hard drive, but may potentially do other tasks returning a
node to a clean state. We have it disabled by default, as it's time-consuming
and our bulk introspection operation does not account for it. However, there is
a valid use case for cleaning, so this patch adds an option to enable it.

Change-Id: Id4946ee08c67610aae4c28e5d28056105e2c0c84

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-15 17:27:03.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.yaml.template'], 'message': "Set glance::registry::auth_uri

We weren't previously setting this, which meant glance registry
would end up pointing at bogus addresses like localhost or
false://false:5000 (because we set the deprecated auth_* params to
false).  This doesn't seem to be causing any problems right now,
but it's clearly wrong.

Change-Id: I4b39d36e93d117bfe52dd4284f0a4661746d9cfb
"}]
commit_message:
Set glance::registry::auth_uri

We weren't previously setting this, which meant glance registry
would end up pointing at bogus addresses like localhost or
false://false:5000 (because we set the deprecated auth_* params to
false).  This doesn't seem to be causing any problems right now,
but it's clearly wrong.

Change-Id: I4b39d36e93d117bfe52dd4284f0a4661746d9cfb

Closes-Bug: 1560484

commit_message:
Increase SCSI bus scan timeout from 10s to 5min

Discovery of a newly-mapped device (used during image capture) is observed to
time out in a loaded environment.  Increasing the timeout from ten
seconds to five minutes.

Change-Id: Ifb4bc184e80c7595beefe9c3142480fca74a7c25
Closes-Bug: 1560484

This covers the scenario where a user changes the admin password,
but fails to update /etc/fuel/astute.yaml and
/root/.config/fuel/fuel_client.yaml. These files need to be
updated to re-run bootstrap_admin_node for simple patching.

This fix is partial because it should include string updates
in fuel-ui, docs, and fuelclient.

Partial-Bug: #1555262
'}]
commit_message:
Fail bootstrap_admin_node if admin password is wrong

This covers the scenario where a user changes the admin password,
but fails to update /etc/fuel/astute.yaml and
/root/.config/fuel/fuel_client.yaml. These files need to be
updated to re-run bootstrap_admin_node for simple patching.

This fix is partial because it should include string updates
in fuel-ui, docs, and fuelclient.

Change-Id: I23f362524eab9649b58a8ba722e6fd6cb1d6b1ab
Partial-Bug: #1555262

commit_message:
Make no response notification(msg) level to INFO

Some API calls just sent but the results were uncertain,
Horizon should notify the user that your request is
just accepted, not successfully.
So this patch change some form message level to INFO,
and some message expression.

Change-Id: I241cd9cf3ad6b2bd747e3ea1c6040a140ba77b56
Closes-Bug: #1326301
Closes-Bug: #1286418

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-30 19:10:46.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/services/auto_allocate/db.py'], 'message': "Rename first argument to extend_dict hook correctly

The first argument should not be called 'self', since the method
is a module function. It should more aptly called 'core_plugin',
because this is what the object passed to the method is going to be.

This is an innocent oversight, but stylistically wrong nonetheless.

Change-Id: Iedc2f227e6875ead0085de0bd3b00ad0477abc83
"}]
commit_message:
Rename first argument to extend_dict hook correctly

The first argument should not be called 'self', since the method
is a module function. It should more aptly called 'core_plugin',
because this is what the object passed to the method is going to be.

This is an innocent oversight, but stylistically wrong nonetheless.

Change-Id: Iedc2f227e6875ead0085de0bd3b00ad0477abc83

Accordind specs and docs, SRIOV_NIC.physical_device_mappings is not

commit_message:
Allow to use several nics for physnet with SR-IOV

Accordind specs and docs, SRIOV_NIC.physical_device_mappings is not
limited to be a 1-1 mapping between physnets and NICs. However,
implementation requires this. This bugfix unlocks 1-M mappings, so one
physnet could be managed by many NICs.

* introduced unique_keys in neutron.utils.parse_mappings
* SRIOV_NIC.physical_device_mappings is parsed as dict with lists as
  values with parse_mappings(..., unique_keys=False)

DocImpact
Change-Id: I07b8682fdfe8389a35893cc662b87c94a00bd4a5
Closes-Bug: #1558626

subject: Fix volume backup import test
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-31 10:36:24.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/volume/admin/test_volumes_backup.py', 'tempest/services/volume/base/base_backups_client.py'], 'message': 'Fix volume backup import test

There is a bug in Cinder (#1455043) and backups are incorrectly imported
into the DB, and once that is fixed current tempest backup import/export
test will fail.

The reason for mentioned failure is that backup imports preserve
original backup id, so we cannot import a backup to a system where it
already exists, as is the case of our test.

This patch fixes this by importing the backup with a "fake" uuid so that
the import doesn't give an error.

Change-Id: I6e76cbdbc87069a2f917ff98e7b9bd88e36946e8
Related-Bug: #1476416
Closes-Bug: #1478062
'}]
commit_message:
Fix volume backup import test

There is a bug in Cinder (#1455043) and backups are incorrectly imported
into the DB, and once that is fixed current tempest backup import/export
test will fail.

The reason for mentioned failure is that backup imports preserve
original backup id, so we cannot import a backup to a system where it
already exists, as is the case of our test.

This patch fixes this by importing the backup with a "fake" uuid so that
the import doesn't give an error.

Change-Id: I6e76cbdbc87069a2f917ff98e7b9bd88e36946e8
Related-Bug: #1476416
Closes-Bug: #1478062

subject: Consistently raise exception if port not found
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-30 11:52:41.000000000', 'files': ['os_win/utils/network/networkutils.py', 'os_win/tests/utils/network/test_networkutils.py'], 'message': "Consistently raise exception if port not found

Doesn't raise an exception on remove_switch_port. If a VM is
destroyed, all of its associated vNICs and switch ports are also
destroyed. The Neutron Hyper-V Agent will notice this fact and
call the remove_switch_port. The Agent will also receive a port_delete
RPC call for the already destroyed port.

Closes-Bug: #1563775

Change-Id: I991e3f664868266e84fde1471b38965b7ad04ca4
(cherry picked from commit c5ea2aaca942cccdc4a37156835c4e4cf7cb04cc)
"}]
commit_message:
Consistently raise exception if port not found

Doesn't raise an exception on remove_switch_port. If a VM is
destroyed, all of its associated vNICs and switch ports are also
destroyed. The Neutron Hyper-V Agent will notice this fact and
call the remove_switch_port. The Agent will also receive a port_delete
RPC call for the already destroyed port.

Closes-Bug: #1563775

Change-Id: I991e3f664868266e84fde1471b38965b7ad04ca4
(cherry picked from commit c5ea2aaca942cccdc4a37156835c4e4cf7cb04cc)

revisions:

commit_message:
python3: Fixes vhdutils internal VHDX size

The method _get_internal_vhdx_size_by_file_size from vhdutils returns a
float in python 3.4, which causes the resize operation to fail, as it
expects an integer.

Change-Id: I07ba6a19f4c85fe3434d3816e32631eb6002f9a9
Closes-Bug: #1564059
(cherry picked from commit ca4eb8a419b6bf6c9a7ea16e25973f0da7f6ed61)

commit_message:
Don't back up ipxe boot image files

On at least some platforms, this is triggering the linked bug,
which makes the module non-idempotent.  Per [1], setting backup to
false works around the problem.

1: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/29540964/puppet-could-not-back-up-file-got-passed-new-contents-for-sum/29606349

Change-Id: I75375b59e6a6193e8d553408c846b179fac3e083
Closes-Bug: 1564006

commit_message:
Allow the user to use percentage on lvm snapsize

If a '%' is part of the freezer option --lvm-snapsize
--extends option will be used instead of --size for the snapshot.

Change-Id: Iffe579c01c385fcea215639cf445f56d3403e9a5
Implements: lvm-size-percentage

subject: Store task results into DB by chunks, retrieve aggregated
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-23 13:56:19.000000000', 'files': ['rally/task/engine.py', 'rally/common/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Store task results into DB by chunks, retrieve aggregated

Runner produces task results by chunks. Before this patch
these chunks were aggregated by task engine and stored
into DB in a single write after task completion.

This patch updates task engine so that chunks of
task results are storred on arrival and are aggregated
when being retrieved from DB.

Change-Id: Ib0e2f122ac814b7954a79c97502d62fc9d0f97b6
'}]
commit_message:
Store task results into DB by chunks, retrieve aggregated

Runner produces task results by chunks. Before this patch
these chunks were aggregated by task engine and stored
into DB in a single write after task completion.

This patch updates task engine so that chunks of
task results are storred on arrival and are aggregated
when being retrieved from DB.

Change-Id: Ib0e2f122ac814b7954a79c97502d62fc9d0f97b6

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1926, 'name': 'Derek Higgins', 'email': 'derekh@redhat.com', 'username': 'derekh'}, {'_account_id': 9268, 'name': 'Gonéri Le Bouder', 'email': 'goneri@redhat.com', 'username': 'goneri'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-23 20:15:46.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/deploy.sh'], 'message': "Clarify location of large output log files

Currently we log some messages that tell the user to look in
/var/log for output from the undercloud install and image builds.
However, we don't tell them where that /var/log actually is.  In
this case it's in undercloud.tar.xz in the CI job directory, so
this change adds that information to the message.

Change-Id: Icb1fd2da06fa8ced9f6a591df88f53c018679398
"}]
commit_message:
Clarify location of large output log files

Currently we log some messages that tell the user to look in
/var/log for output from the undercloud install and image builds.
However, we don't tell them where that /var/log actually is.  In
this case it's in undercloud.tar.xz in the CI job directory, so
this change adds that information to the message.

Change-Id: Icb1fd2da06fa8ced9f6a591df88f53c018679398

commit_message:
Show qos_specs_id based on policy

Right now qos_specs_id is only shown to an admin user
when showing a volume type. This patch changes that to
be based on policy to allow for more flexibility. It
also adds unit tests for showing a volume type
with policy permissions for qos_specs_id as well as
extra_specs.

APIImpact

Change-Id: I4e6e99b8992b6941ba247bee90493cc2adba7f0b
Closes-bug: #1512876

commit_message:
Fix network tasks order

Neutron resources (networks, routers) should be created after appropriate
agents, otherwise they can be left unscheduled

Closes-bug: #1541297

Change-Id: I9b4517907d456f42feb626dcab4849ff0c389102

subject: Fail when ansible-galaxy returns error
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-29 03:26:53.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/bootstrap-ansible.sh', 'tox.ini', 'ansible-role-requirements.yml'], 'message': 'Fail when ansible-galaxy returns error

Remove the --ignore-errors flag from the ansible-galaxy command used to
pull in the roles required by the project. If a role fails to be
installed, ignoring the error only moves the failure from
bootstrap-ansible.sh to the playbooks.

Adjust the ordering of the roles in the requirements file so that
dependencies are installed before they are required. This is necessary
because the roles are not on Ansible Galaxy.

Modify tox.ini so that the functional testing does not ignore errors.

Change-Id: Id68affada5cf2380b0388d45a9baf6b4839824c7
'}]
commit_message:
Fail when ansible-galaxy returns error

Remove the --ignore-errors flag from the ansible-galaxy command used to
pull in the roles required by the project. If a role fails to be
installed, ignoring the error only moves the failure from
bootstrap-ansible.sh to the playbooks.

Adjust the ordering of the roles in the requirements file so that
dependencies are installed before they are required. This is necessary
because the roles are not on Ansible Galaxy.

Modify tox.ini so that the functional testing does not ignore errors.

Change-Id: Id68affada5cf2380b0388d45a9baf6b4839824c7

commit_message:
Remove DKMS kernel modules i40e and hpsa from bootstrap by default

The DKMS kernel modules (like i40e and hpsa-dkms) could be added
manually on bootstrap by fuel-bootstrap utility since MOS 8.0.
The list of the packages installed into IBP could be manually
managed since MOS 9.0. Removing the DKMS packages as shipped on
bootstrap by default.

Change-Id: I3e0c9dc45c8d0bbe9d97c03052cdbf9214876864
Closes-Bug: #1546432
